title.narrative: Livestock Development for Community Empowerment Project

description.narrative: The project will assist 300 families by providing them with approximately 450 meat goats, 130 water buffaloes, 20 cows and 35 pigs. The project will support 4 breeding centers with 8 bulls (cow & buffalo), 4 bucks and 4 boars. Additionally, 2 nitrogen containers, 4 semen refrigerators and artificial insemination guns will be provided for artificial insemination. Four project participants will be trained as artificial inseminators. 120 project families will benefit from the breeding service. An additional 765 families will benefit through passing on the gifts. The project will also partially support project participants’ initiative to set up 5 hand pumps for drinking water and 1 motor pump for irrigation. The project families will receive fodder seeds/saplings and the groups will be provided funds for vegetable seeds and fruit saplings. The project participants will receive trainings on Heifer’s Cornerstones, group management, improved animal management, kitchen gardening, forage production, reproductive health and HIV/AIDs awareness. The male members of the project families will be trained on Heifer Cornerstones and gender and justice training. The project participants will be taken for exchange visit to nearby Heifer project sites. An additional 13 youth of the project families will be organized into a youth group and will receive training on Heifer’s Cornerstones.
